XMLlist.entry: Functions to make searches in the catalogue
Make a simple search

The type of the search: 0 (SEARCH_ALL)=all the fields, 1 (SEARCH_TITLE)=title, 2 (SEARCH_AUTHOR)=author, 3 (SEARCH_EDITOR)=editor, 4 (SEARCH_COLLECTION)=collection, 6 (SEARCH_CATEGORIES)=categories/subject heading words
string to search
the id of a pmb user, to filter the results depending on the access rights. -1: Do not take into account
the id of a borrower, to filter the results depending on the access rights -1: Do not take into account 0: anonymous borrower x: id of the borrower
name of the result resource
number of results found
Retrieve the list of searchable fields in advanced search mode
in which research domain are we. example: search_simple_fields, opac|search_fields
the language we want the results to be in
if we also want the different possible values of the fields, (for the select fields for example)
A table of search fields
Retrieve the informagions of a search field
the id of the field we want the informations from
search domain in which we are. example: search_simple_fields, opac|search_fields
The language in which we want to see the result
if we also want the different possible values of the field (for the fields for example)
a search field
Make an advanced search
search domain in which we are. example: search_simple_fields, opac|search_fields
the search: a table of a search structure
the operator betweene the field and the previous field
the id of the research field
the search operator
the search values
the id of a pmb user, to filter the results depending on the access rights. -1: do not take into account.
the id of a borrower, to filter the results, depending on the access rights -1: Do not take into account 0: anonymous borrower x: id of the borrower
name of the result resource
number of results found
Retrieve the records resulting from a search
the id returned by the search function
number of the first record to retrieve
number of records to retrieve
results format
the charset in which we want the result
include the links between the records, issues and articles
include the copies in the zone 995
the id of the record
the record in the requested format
A results table
Retrieve the records resulting from a search, applying the sorting rules

The sortType parameter builds itself the following way: typedutri_nomdutri, with: -typedutri: d or c for an ascending or descending sorting -nomdutri: the id of the sorting (see the function get_sort_types).
examples: -c_text_1: sorting by ascending title. -d_num_7: sorting by descending publishing year. -c_text_5: sorting by ascending call number.
the id returned by the search function
number of the first record to retrieve
number of records to retrieve
format of the results
the charset in which we want the results
include the links between records, issues and articles
include the copies in the zone 995
the sorting rules to apply to the results
A table of results
the id of the record
the record in the requested format
Retrieve the cords resulting from a search
the id returned by the research function
number of the first record to retrieve
number of records to retrieve
the charset in which we want the results
include the links between records, issues and articles
include the copies in the zone 995
A table of results
Retrieve the records resulting from a search, applying the sorting rules

The sortType parameter builds itself the following way: typedutri_nomdutri, with: -typedutri: d or c for an ascending or descending sorting -nomdutri: the id of the sorting (see the function get_sort_types).
examples: -c_text_1: sorting by ascending title. -d_num_7: sorting by descending publishing year. -c_text_5: sorting by ascending call number.
the id returned by the search function
number of the first record to retrieve
number of records to retrieve
le charset in which we want the results
include the links between records, issues and articles
include the copies in the zone 995
the sorting to apply to the results
A table of results
Unknown search standard
Returns the list of the different possible sorting types

Example of return: Array ( [0] => Array ( [sort_name] => text_1 [sort_caption] => Title )
[1] => Array ( [sort_name] => num_2 [sort_caption] => Decimal indexation )
[2] => Array ( [sort_name] => text_3 [sort_caption] => Author ) ... )
The sorting types
The id of a sorting type
The name of a sorting type
Make a simple search filtered by location and section

The type of search: 0 (SEARCH_ALL)=all the fields, 1 (SEARCH_TITLE)=title, 2 (SEARCH_AUTHOR)=author, 3 (SEARCH_EDITOR)=editor, 4 (SEARCH_COLLECTION)=collection, 6 (SEARCH_CATEGORIES)=categories/subject heading words
string to search
the id of a pmb user, to filter the results depending on their access rights. -1: Do not take into account
the id of a borrower, to filter the results depending on their access rights. -1: Do not take into account 0: anonymous borrower x: id of the borrower
name of the result resource
number of results found
